sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The history of the late English rebellion, deduced from its first flame in 1640. And continued to the quenching thereof by His Majesties happy restauration [sic], 1660. / By W. Y. To which is added Fundamentum patriæ or, Englands settlement being a view of the state affairs in this kingdom, since His Majesties restauration, to the year, 1665. Younger, William, 1605-1662.
[6], 148 [i.e. 149], [3]; [2], 76 p.
Printed for Tho. Rooks, at the Lamb and Ink-bottle at the East-end of S. Pauls, who makes the best ink for records, London : 1665.
"W.Y." = William Younger. "Fundamentum patriæ: or, England's settlement", published anonymously, has its own titlepage, signatures and pagination. Numerous errors in pagination. Imperfect: stained and tightly bound with slight loss of text. Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
=======

Printed for Tho. Rooks, at the Lamb and Ink-bottle at the East-end of S. Pauls, who makes the best ink for records, London : 1665.
"W.Y." = William Younger. "Fundamentum patriæ: or, England's settlement", published anonymously, has its own titlepage, signatures and pagination. Numerous errors in pagination.
